archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.name: Data Center and Network Infrastructure
archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.documentation:
Data Center and Network Infrastructure
Key Relationship Flows in the Diagram
1. Power Flow Path: UPS → PDU → All Racks (Server, Network, Storage) 2. Cooling Flow Path: HVAC → ServerRoom 3. Network Connectivity Path: ComputeServers → NetworkInterfaces → DataCenterLAN → Other Networks 4. Storage Connectivity Path: StorageArrays → StorageInterfaces → StorageAreaNetwork 5. Service Realization Path: o Physical Devices → System Software → Technology Services o For example: ComputeServer → Hypervisor → ComputeService 6. Facility Containment Hierarchy: DataCenterFacility → Various Rooms → Equipment Racks → Individual Devices
This diagram illustrates how a data center's components are organized in layers from physical facility down to technology services, demonstrating both physical and logical dependencies between elements at each layer.

children.name: Physical Infrastructure Layer
children.documentation:
Physical Infrastructure Layer Components in the Diagram
ServerRack (Node)
• Connected to ComputeServer1 and ComputeServer2 via composition relationships • Receives power from PDU
Compute Server (VHSw, FBSv, DSD, & CADSv) (Device)
• Connected to Hypervisor1 and Hypervisor2 respectively via assignment relationships • Connected to NetworkInterfaces via association relationships • Mounted within ServerRack (composition relationship)
NetworkRack (Node)
• Connected to CoreSwitch, EdgeRouter, and Firewall via composition relationships • Receives power from PDU
Managed Switches (Core Switches) (Device)
• Connected to DataCenterLAN and ManagementNetwork via realization relationships • Connected to NetworkOS via assignment relationship • Mounted within NetworkRack (composition relationship)
EdgeRouter (Device)
• Connected to DMZNetwork via realization relationship • Mounted within NetworkRack (composition relationship)
Firewall (Device)
• Connected to SecurityService via realization relationship • Mounted within NetworkRack (composition relationship)
StorageRack (Node)
• Connected to StorageArray1 and StorageArray2 via composition relationships • Receives power from PDU
StorageArray1 & StorageArray2 (Device)
• Connected to StorageAreaNetwork via realization relationships • Connected to StorageInterfaces via association relationships • Connected to SAN_Management software via assignment relationship • Mounted within StorageRack (composition relationship)
UPS (Device)
• Connected to PDU via serving relationship (provides power) • Located within PowerRoom (aggregation relationship)
PDU (Power Distribution Unit) (Device)
• Connected to ServerRack, NetworkRack, and StorageRack via serving relationships • Receives power from UPS • Located within PowerRoom (aggregation relationship)
HVAC System (Device)
• Connected to ServerRoom via serving relationship (provides cooling) • Located within CoolingRoom (aggregation relationship)

children.name: Facility Layer
children.documentation:
Facility Layer Components in the Diagram
DataCenterFacility (Node)
• Connected to ServerRoom, PowerRoom, CoolingRoom, and SecurityPerimeter via composition relationships • Acts as the top-level container for all physical spaces
ServerRoom (Node)
• Connected to ServerRack, NetworkRack, and StorageRack via aggregation relationships • Receives cooling service from HVAC system
PowerRoom (Node)
• Connected to UPS and PDU via aggregation relationships • Houses power management infrastructure
CoolingRoom (Node)
• Connected to HVAC system via aggregation relationship • Contains climate control systems
SecurityPerimeter (Node)
• Connected to DataCenterFacility via composition relationship • Forms the security boundary of the facility

children.name: System Software Layer
children.documentation:
System Software Layer Components in the Diagram
Hypervisor1 (System Software)
• Assigned to ComputeServer1 and ComputeServer2 respectively • Realize ComputeService
SAN_Management (System Software)
• Assigned to StorageArray1 and StorageArray2 • Realizes StorageService and BackupService
NetworkOS (System Software)
• Assigned to CoreSwitch • Realizes NetworkService
MonitoringSoftware (System Software)
• Shown in the System Software layer but without explicit relationships in the diagram

children.name: Network Infrastructure Layer
children.documentation:
Network Infrastructure Layer Components in the Diagram
DataCenterLAN (Network)
• Realized by CoreSwitch • Connected to StorageAreaNetwork, ManagementNetwork, and DMZNetwork via communication path relationships • Accessed by NetworkInterfaces
StorageAreaNetwork (Network)
• Realized by Storage Sand • Has communication path relationship with DataCenterLAN • Accessed by StorageInterfaces
ManagementNetwork (Network)
• Realized by CoreSwitch • Has communication path relationship with DataCenterLAN • Accessed by NetworkInterfaces
DMZNetwork (Network)
• Realized by EdgeRouter • Has communication path relationship with DataCenterLAN
NetworkInterfaces (Technology Interface)
• Associated with ComputeServer1 and ComputeServer2 • Access DataCenterLAN and ManagementNetwork
StorageInterfaces (Technology Interface)
• Associated with StorageArray1 and StorageArray2 • Access StorageAreaNetwork

children.name: Technology Service Layer
children.documentation:
Technology Services Layer Components in the Diagram
ComputeService (Technology Service)
• Realized by Hypervisor1 and Hypervisor2
StorageService (Technology Service)
• Realized by SAN_Management software
NetworkService (Technology Service)
• Realized by NetworkOS
SecurityService (Technology Service)
• Realized by Firewall
BackupService (Technology Service)
• Realized by SAN_Management software
